ElementAnimationcancel_event.summary: The animationcancel event is fired when a CSS Animation unexpectedly aborts. In other words, any time it stops running without sending an event. This might happen when the {{cssxref("animation-name")}} is changed such that the animation is removed, or when the animating node is hidden using CSS. Therefore, either directly or because any of its containing nodes are hidden.

remarks.para: An event handler for this event can be added by setting the onanimationcancel property, or using .
